description: Converts and organizes music without a problem, great program.
It does one thing, and does it well. You can convert many files at once... to open formats.

This app used to work fantastically well but after fedora 27 upgrade every time I try to convert my .m4a files into .ogg format. The program automatically crashes and closes itself. I don't know what's the problem. Only if developers can fix it then it will be helpful.

Nice UI, works flawlessly on OpenSUSE Tumbleweed

Note for those having issues, it depends on you having codecs installed for the formats you wish to convert from/to, so you will most likely want to install the gstreamer-plugins-bad and/or gstreamer-plugins-ugly to get the proprietary codecs

Best app, very very good

I like this one as it is easy to use. One thing is missing : while converting multiple folders with additional music data in it like txt etc the error will pup up and program will wait until error is accepted by user. it is ok if you have one file like this but with larger library you can't just let the computer do its job as an errors will come up quite often. If possible please add possibility to skip files different than music files.
The multiple files conversion works like a charm.

It's okay. It replicates the folder structure of your music library when converting audio rather than dumping everything into one big folder which is nice if many files have the same name and you don't want them to be overwritten. And it can selectively format desired audio formats if you have a mix of FLAC and MP3 and you only want to convert the FLAC files. My only issue comes down to the fact that it cannot handle very large libraries very well and it will crash if you try to convert too many (my library has over 20,000 files).

If this bug gets fixed then I will be ever so thankful as I can't find anything better than this software on Linux that does what I need.
summary: It works but crashes on bigger tasks

description: Not only does it work very well, it also looks good. I'm impressed.
Could not convert 90% of the files. Constant errors & conversion bars freezing near completion. Not good.

I use this application to convert from FLAC to MP3. The application takes full advantage of multi-threading which converts the tracks simultaneously and makes it one of the fastest converters I've ever used.

While the application itself has a simple interface, it is highly configurable and allows you to choose the quality of the output files. It also allows you to chose the destination and the format of the file names.

This software package is so easy & simple to use all you need to do: left click & hold on the mouse button, the album or piece of music you wish to convert carry it across & place in the soundconverter then click convert & in no time at all your music is converted to what ever you require (MP3,WAVE,FLAC-ETC)
You have to pay for something like this on Windows
summary: This has to be the best audio converter i've ever seen

description:
I used the app to convert m4a files with shuttering behavior on an android device. Despite the incompatibility ("invalid files") warning, SoundConverter worked like a charm.
By default SoundConverter will create .ogg files in the same directory of the audio files to be converted. Output path, filename, extension and directory structure are editable. Output as MP3 is available in a variety of qualities.
summary: A great solution to easily convert problematic audio files

description: I had a long list of compressed sound files, about 36 Gb in total. Some of them were in MP4 format and did not play on some devices. It was quite a big job to convert all to MP3 but this app did it speedily and smoothly, converting a list of tracks in what seemed like 20 seconds or so. I am using an Intel i7 running at 12 GHz which helps. I can't vouch for speed on a less powerful machine. And the fan burst into life after each set of conversions, but I'd never have done the job with less efficient software.
